dc_description_s: The DC Commission on the Arts and Humanities recognizes the importance of remaining relevant in a city of competitive opportunities for residents who have at their disposal significant discretionary income for arts and cultural offerings.   Further1 billion in economic activity is generated annually by the non-profit arts and culture industry in Washington  Additionally  These trends create an opportunity for DCCAH to position itself at the forefront of the city’s cultural planning.   To achieve this goal<a href=Nhttps://www.irs.gov/Charities--Non-Profits/Charitable-Organizations/Exemption-Requirements-Section-501(c)(3)-OrganizationsN target=N_blankN>Exemption Requirements - 501(c)(3) Organizations
dct_spatial_sm: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
dc_title_s: Arts and Culture Organizations as 501(c)3: Washington, D.C.
